mdContact.rpOrgName: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

distorCont.rpOrgName: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

idCitation.resTitle: 2020 Fire History polygons of Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Park
Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This coverage represents the SEKI fire history from 1921 through 2020. A seperate database exists that has attribute information based on the common relate item called "gisno". This was linked to the WFMI database but that was only updated through 2019. The 2020 updates were manually populated from Inform since there was no integrated dataset yet. Some of the spatial data is blocky because it originated as a GRASS coverage with 30 meter resolution. Beginning in 1996, the fire history data has been digitally developed in Arc/Info. The resulting smooth line polygon shapefiles depict fires that are 1996 and later. A significant quality control process has increased the accuracy of attributes in the 2002 version and later.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This data can be used for a variety of purposes including fire planning, operational applications, burned area recovery applications.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Park Staff

idPoC.rpOrgName: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

placeKeys.keyword: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

searchKeys.keyword: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

LegConsts.useLimit: The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics ("GIF" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indireclty through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.

dataExt.exDesc: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

report.measDesc: This data comes from the WFMI system so it should be very good.
report.evalMethDesc: Spot checked and reviewed by internal users.

report.measDesc: General accuracy is impossible to consistently report as each fire could have originated on either a 7.5 minute or 15 minute quad map. The individual who drew the fire perimeter is the source. Point fires have been buffered to a 30 meter grid cell size. Some fires were digitized in the approximate area since no exact map was given, but the description was enough to give an area and approximate size. Good - lower accuracy with older fire data. The point (small fires) or polygon (larger) fires were digitized. However, the accuracy of individual fires will be variable depending on the individual who drew the polygon on a basemap. Beginning in 1996, some large fires were GPS'ed with PLGR units. 2008 and later fires mostly get mapped with Garmin 60s or better.

datasetSeries.seriesName: USGS Standard Series of 7.5-minute Topographic Quadrangles
datasetSeries.issId: [State] Catalog of Topographic and Other Published Maps

prcStep.stepDesc: Hand or GPS digitized and then atributed via table data from the Wildland Fire Management Information System (WFMI)

stepProc.rpOrgName: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks

enttyp.enttypd: Provides specific information on individual fires from fire report.
enttyp.enttypds: Sequoia and Kings Canyon modified from WFMI Download of 1202 Data

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Linkage to WFMI database consisting of YEARNO and Firenumber

attr.attrdefs: WFMI combines Firetype and Protection Type

edom.edomvd: Natural outs, Other lands protected by NPS under a MOU, interagency agreement, or contract
Natural outs, NPS lands protected by another non-fed agency
Suppress Fires, for fires suppressed under a confine or contain strategy
Suppressed Fires, other lands not under an agreement, where NPS action taken to prevent spread to NPS land
Suppressed Fires, other lands protected by NPS under a MOU, interagency agreement, or contract
Natural outs, NPS land under NPS protection
Natural outs, NPS lands protected by another fed agency
Suppressed Fires, NPS land under NPS protection
Suppressed Fires, NPS lands protected by another non-federal agency
Suppressed Fires, NPS lands protected by another federal agency
Naturals outs, Other lands not under an agreement, where NPS action taken to prevent spread to NPS land

attr.attrdef: Owner of land on which fire started
Linkage to GIS database, YEAR + GIS Fire #

Used internally to calculate statistics on whether fires were predominately suppression or fire use. RX fires do not receive a value. Only coded as yes for fires where no suppression action was taken. Many wilderness fires are only monitored by air.

edom.edomvd: Fire had some kind of suppression action taken

overview.eaover: The polygon attribute table contains a field by name of NIFCLINK, which joins the WFMI attribute dataset to the local GISNO linked spatial dataset. A linkage between these 2 numbering systems is maintained locally. The UTME and UTMN from the locally maintained dataset represents the most accurate version of ignition locations.
overview.eadetcit: Click on link to users guide for the WFMI Fire Reporting System. http://www.nifc.blm.gov/nsdu/fire_reporting/NPS/doc/UserGuides.html
